actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to extend beyond age 22 the period during which an individual may be entitled to child's insurance benefits on the basis of full-time student status where such individual was prevented by reason of health, religious service, or service in the Armed Forces (after attaining age 18) from attending school during 1 or more months prior to attaining age 22.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Extends beyond age 22 the period during which an individual may be entitled to child's insurance benefits under title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act on the basis of fulltime student status where such individual was prevented by reason of health, religious service, or service in the Armed Forces (after attaining age 18) from attending school during one or more months prior to attaining age 22.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to extend beyond age 22 the period during which an individual may be entitled to child's insurance benefits on the basis of full-time student status where such individual was prevented by reason of health, religious service, or service in the Armed Forces (after attaining age 18) from attending school during 1 or more months prior to attaining age 22.
